lead_paragraph: The law requires notification to Medicare beneficiaries that they may incur huge out-of-pocket costs if they seek care at nursing homes after not being formally admitted to hospitals as inpatients.

headline.print_headline: New Medicare Law Orders Notification of Loophole
headline.main: New Medicare Law to Notify Patients of Loophole in Nursing Home Coverage

snippet: The law requires notification to Medicare beneficiaries that they may incur huge out-of-pocket costs if they seek care at nursing homes after not being formally admitted to hospitals as inpatients....
abstract: Medicare's Notice Act requires hospitals to notify patients that they could incur large out-of-pocket expenses during and after their care if they are not being admitted for inpatient care and are instead being kept for 'observation.'
